task.question: What role in the kingdom did Darius son of Xerxes have (Dan 9:1)?

choices.choice: He ruled over Judah and Jerusalem
He was made ruler over the Babylonian kingdom
He ruled from Susa over the Medes and the Persians
He sat on the throne of his father for time, times and ½ time

task.answer: He was made ruler over the Babylonian kingdom

task.question: When Daniel realized the seventy years of Jerusalem’s desolation were up he pleaded to God in prayer with all of the following EXCEPT (Dan 9:3)
How did Daniel address God in his prayer over the seventy years (Dan 9:4)?

choices.choice: As the One who freed his people from their bondage
As the one who keeps his covenant of love
As the maker of heaven and earth

task.answer: As the one who keeps his covenant of love

task.question: With whom does God keep his covenant of love (Dan 9:4)?

choices.choice: With those who love him and obey his commands
With those who walk in his ways
With the righteous and holy people of God
With those giving justice to the fatherless and widows

task.answer: With those who love him and obey his commands

task.question: When Daniel is confessing the sins of the nation in regard to the seventy years of exile he uses all of the following terms EXCEPT (Dan 9:5)
To whom does Daniel say Israel had not listened (Dan 9:6)?

choices.choice: The visions and dreams God had sent

task.question: Daniel says in his prayer of confession that the prophets had spoken to all of the following groups EXCEPT (Dan 9:6)
Why does Daniel admit that the men of Judah were covered with shame (Dan 9:7)?

choices.choice: Because they did not believe God
Because they fell short of God’s kingdom

task.question: Daniel lists all of the following as being covered with shame because of their sin EXCEPT (Dan 9:8)
How does Daniel say God gave them his law (Dan 9:10)?

choices.choice: He wrote it with his finger on stone
He put it in the ark of the covenant
He gave it to them through the prophets
He had it written down and read by the Levites

task.answer: He gave it to them through the prophets
